Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bruces99
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at this hotel and was very pleased. Came in on the train and the hotel is at the top of the steps from the Metro. There is a 10 minute walk to the colloseum and then on into the city centre. The room was very comfortable and the staff very helpful, nothing was too much bother. After a couple of days walking around just stayed in the hotel bar, the menu is basic but the the wine was excellent. We will definitely be going back as it was perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ardana1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here. I found it to be well maintained, immaculately clean, and very conveniently located, being an easy walk to the Colosseum, Saint John Lateran and just a few feet from a Metro stop. The hotel staff was very helpful, and the breakfast buffet was more than adequate. The only down side to the stay was that only one lift was working, and it frequently took multiple detours on the way to the correct floor, not stopping on the requested floor before passing it for a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ManuelaMarco
Reviews.Content: amazing breakfast, enjoyed our stay, not exactly centrally located, but good nonetheless. typicall best western standards

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like true guests”
Reviews.Author: opb154
Reviews.Content: I was able to take my 79 year old father to Rome to visit the sights and see his parents' home town -not far away. We decided to stay at the Best Western President due to a rec. by AAA, the location-near the coliseum, and the value. My dad has dementia and his security is a great concern for me. The hotel provided us with all that we needed to feel at home away from home. The concierge assisted us daily with our sightseeing plans and advice as to times, locations, weather, rental car and traffic knowing that my father could run a bit slow and tire at his age. When I do return to Rome, as everyone does, we will again stay at the President. It is less than one block from subway, a tremendous coffee shop and up the hill from the Forum and Coliseum--and all that this area has to offer. The rooms were recently renovated and provided us with comfort, privacy, and security that you would expect. The breakfast offered had enough choices hot, cold, breakfast and lunch items to hold us over until dinner--all included. The bar area at night was lively and professional. This place needed to be a gem for us as the day's events brought us home to rest and plan for the next day. Every effort on the part of each staff member is made to make you feel like you are welcome, appreciated as a valued customer and a guest to their country. You will not be disappointed for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and friendly place!”
Reviews.Author: Blah12345678910
Reviews.Content: Me and my cousin went to Rome and the place where we were meant to stay wasn't what it was in the pictures. So in the middle of the night we were walking the streets of Rome trying to find a place to stay. We walked into best western and the staff helped us out so much they took us in and made us feel at home. I would highly recommend this place if your looking for a nice place to stay and a chilled and relaxed holiday. Staff were friendly and ever so helpful!! Would stay here anytime! A*

Reviews.Title: “Location is best asset”
Reviews.Author: gwenday
Reviews.Content: Situated steps away from Manzoni metro station is hotel's biggest asset for Rome sightseeing. Within easy walking distance of Colosseum and Forum, all other sites easily accessed by metro. Hotel has many tour parties, mainly Asian and American, so service totally impersonal, with arrivals/departures at all hours, day and night. Breakfast selection very variable, synthetic fruit juice, machine coffee, maybe hot dishes of scrambled egg and cocktail sausage/bacon pieces, maybe none! If you want to eat dinner in hotel in evening must order before 1400 aech day for a trhree course fixed menu for 20 Euros (excluding beverages). There is a very limited (quality and choice) bar menu, which we used once - we saw no other diners . . . .Nearby pizza bars are only realistically priced option, with one "chain" pizzeria and one more expensive (30-40 Euros) restaurant within 10 minute walk. Rooms OK for short stay, but sound insulation between rooms, corridors and floors make nights tiring especially due to tour parties. Would describe hotel as no more than 3 star, definitely not 4 star by any international standard; as such, it is quite expensive, but location makes it a good short break choice - if you can bear the tour parties! (Do not be surprised if you cannot recognise the hotel from the "owner's" photo - the hotel entance is direcly onto the pavement . . . and was taken at night for good reason)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BrittlePeanut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, the rooms are clean and well presented - the breakfast is good and the staff helpful. The rooms are small, but very comfortable - it's an ideal base for sight seeing. If you want more luxury then it's probably not for you - but I would stay again happily. The only thing I would say is that the room was too warm and we couldn't turn the heat down - given that it was below freezing outside at the time that was some achievement! Oh and the drains in the bathroom had an unpleasant smell - but not enough for us to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: FREDANDWILMA
Reviews.Content: A good city centre hotel brilliantly located. Leaves a liitle to be desired but in all fairness it is a city centre hotel more like a good 3* rather than 4* Reception staff and breakfast room manager were extremely good and helpful but the rooms have little "storeage space" the room we had had no drawers but plenty of wardrobe space. We would reccommend this hotel but be aware it is a little tired but great location for a traveller. anyt nore than a few days and we would be unhappy

Reviews.Title: “Great family central location”
Reviews.Author: ashcan
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading reviews and wasn't disappointed. Although not cheap 130 euro a day, was worth it. The room was big enough for a family of four, the kids having 2 single camp beds and a large bed for us. The bathroom had a big walk in shower and a plentiful supply of toiletries. The room has a fridge which was useful in the summer heat. The breakfast buffet had a wide range of hot and cold food and set us up for the day. The hotel is outside the manzoni tube, although the line was being upgraded so took the bus to the Termini about 5 to 10 mins away. In the same time you can walk to the Coleseum past a curry restaurant we tried. We ate at the small piccola hong kong 50yds to the right of the entrance, where food can be had for 5-6 euros. The staff were helpful, getting our room ready with our early arrival. Bags can be left by the dining room, not totally secure, but nothing disappeared. Overall comfortable base close to main attractions in a quiet neighbourhood. Some may find the lift a big on the small size and precious little chance of getting on the internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational location - a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeaZapada
Reviews.Content: Hotel President was great. First the location: walking distance from the Colosseum and next to (5 meters) Manzoni metro station (direct link to the Vatican). The room: decent size with comfortable (memory foam) beds and really nice pillows (they even have a pillow menu which you can consult). Toilets are new and quite spacious. Also, there are large wardrobe with plenty of hanging space. TV is ok (I bet you will not watch a single minute of it - it's too many beautiful things outside to just stay in). I didn't visit the restaurant - but I can tell that the services overall were great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value 4* Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PragueorBust
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for €109 for two nights via Compare-Hotels.co (comparison site) which we felt was an incredible deal for a 4* Hotel. The hotel is 10 seconds from Manzioni station (2 stops on the red line to Termini) and a 5 minute walk to the Colloseum. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfasts were not up to much but were typical of Italian breakfasts since the 1950s - ham, eggs and a few mini sausages with pastries and toast available. The room, was actually huge and luxurious, all the mod cons, really fast and powerful shower, free wifi and very clean room. We loved it and I'm baffled as to the 400 ranking on Tripadvisor. Had I paid over €200 I would have less praise but for €109 for 2 nights 2 people = bargain.

Reviews.Title: “WOW.....a fantastic break!”
Reviews.Author: caroline196260
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 'The President' this week with my husband to celebrate my birthday in Rome. From arrival to departure the staff were most courteous and helpful. Room on the 4th floor overlooking courtyard was fantastic, spacious and spotlessly clean every day. Only ate breakfast in the hotel which was continental but plenty of choice. Reception staff helped plan every day ensuring we saw what we wanted in the best way - travel and organised trips etc. We both love 'fish' and the restaurant recommended turned out to be 'Rome's best kept secret' - You will find 'Le Virtu in Tavola' by turning right from hotel entrance and then first right 100 m down the road - We have travelled plenty and always look for a fish restaurant, this has to be the best yet! Ended up going back on our last night as well... Would like to say a 'huge' thankyou to the staff of the President for making my birthday a truly memorable break

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MiddleAgeAussie
Reviews.Content: Must agree with the recent reviews - the Hotel President was great in every way. Even the "Leader of the Opposition" who is at times somewhat fanatical about cleanliness gave it a white-gloved thumbs up. First the room: Decent size with comfortable, king-size bed. Large wardrobe with plenty of hanging space. Good size bathroom with bathtub and bidet. Desk, armchair and of course air-con to keep us warm during our Christmas stay. Service: Extraordinary. We checked in at just after 8:00 a.m. and were admitted to our room on the 5th "piano". (Gotta love that language!) And it just got better. At our first breakfast we were staring querulously at the all-in-one coffee dispenser when one of the white coats approached, "Cappuccino, signora e signore?" We gratefully refused and wondered wether a couple of espressos might be possible. "Si, certo." Within a minute 2 cups of delightful Italian espresso appeared on our table. Then a second, and a third. Thereafter, each morning as we entered the restaurant for our ante-meridial repast, the ever delightful Fabrizio would, without being asked, deliver two espressos to our table. And, noting that we had finished our meal would return with two more. Made us feel special. Location: Ideal. As others have noted it's just a ten or fifteen minute walk to the Colosseum - or for the ambulatorily challenged a 2 minute train ride on the Metro. And once you reach the Colosseum time doesn't matter. You lose yourself in the wonder of the place. Cross the road and follow the Via Dei Fori Imperiali along side the Foro Romano toward the Piazza Del Campidoglio. Priceless and timeless. And still there's more. Exit the Hotel and turn left. Turn left again into Via Manzoni. About three doors down you'll come to an amazing "alimentari" or deli'. This is the best place in Rome. Dive in and marvel at the selection of "fromagi" and salami. Try the pitted, marinated green olives and the sun-dried tomatoes. And before leaving grab a bottle of chianti - about 6 Euros. Sensational. But there's more! Exit the hotel and turn right. About 50 metres up the road you'll come to a little wine shop. Go in and talk to the old guy who runs the place. Ask him to recommend a bottle of "vino rosso" or "chianti". He'll talk to you enthusiastically and point out various bottles. You won't understand a word he says but you'll know exactly what he means and you'll leave with a bottle of Chianti classico for about 8 Euros. Just a a wonderful experience. Once you are suitably provisioned, scurry back to the hotel, go to the bar and press the call button. Within moment a charming and helpful waiter will appear. Ask if you might borrow a couple of wine glasses and perhaps a plate or two to take back to your room. Of course, this will be no trouble at all and you'll probably be offered knives, forks etc. They are just nice people. So, yes, try the Hotel President. We'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Monica294458
Reviews.Content: I was there in September 2011. Rated 4 stars. Good location, 2 metro stops from Termini ( I wanted to avoid this area), just near the Manzoni station, and a 15 minutes walk to the Colosseum. The staff is friendly and speak English very well.They gave us free maps and directions about what to visit. We asked in advance for a quiet room, that is towards an inner courtyard with trees. The room is very nice, and the bathroom even better. It has free Wi-Fi, but pay attention to the plug, it's a small one. Breakfast is served in a beautiful restaurant and there are a lot of choices. If you book in advance you can catch a special offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: use_online
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel, good location, ideally located within 20 feet from a Metro station. It is also less than 40 minutes walk from most attraction and ones further can be accessed easily via the Metro. Breakfast is excellent, especially after 7 am when hot breakfast is also available. There are many small but noticeable perks too such as free Wi-Fi almost everywhere in the hotel, hot tea and coffee at reception at all times, TV in room with English news channels, windows that open and an ample wardrobe in room. The staff are very helpful and well informed with local knowledge, even room service and housekeeping spoke English adequately and were very helpful. Two issues to note though; there is no temperature control in the room. This is apparently centrally controlled so our room was round 25 degrees Celsius most day time dropping only slightly over night. Secondly, the shower cubicle is nonexistent, so the water run across about 30-40% of the toilet floor is one is not careful. I cannot fault anything else as this is otherwise a superb hotel and will stay there if the price is right again.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Maja_travelling
Reviews.Content: I Love Best Western Hotel....it is my 2nd review of my 2nd time there....Staying at this wonderful hotel is a MUST.....i stayed there for 4 nights...it is very comfortable as usual....i LOVE the rooms....very warm feeling of being at home in Rome....it has FREE WI-Fi internet which is wonderful for a traveling person....the food is excellent at the hotel....and it is very near to MANZONI metro station which will take u everywhere....Best Western Hotel....I love you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and recommended”
Reviews.Author: Minoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in November. This is a good hotel which, overall, meets expectations and extremely well located. I don't understand many of the negative messages on some of the other reviews. I travel widely for both pleasure and business, having stayed in literally hundreds of hotels, and found this hotel to be as good as any. The front room we had was noisy because the window did not shut properly. I didn't even need to ask for another room, they transferred me immediately, the next morning. The rooms are clean and a good size for European hotels, so please don't compare with mid and far east and the US. Pleasant and courteous staff, and a good breakfast. It was busy at breakfast but not overcrowded and the food just kept coming with the staff working very hard to keep the place clean and well stocked. I've paid more to stay in worse hotels (some being famous brand four and five star) but not really found anywhere better for the price. Just get the windows fixed on the front rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: DBG58
Reviews.Content: An average hotel who needs for sure refurbishing. Rooms decoration old fashioned. The room (we had a triple) was quite comfortable but smelly. But the big problem is the noise. Impossible to sleep for the 2 nights we spent there. Our room was at the 6th floor but we had the impression sleeping on the sidewalk. Otherwise, good location with a metro stop just next door and at 10 mm walk to Colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “good buy”
Reviews.Author: oestepr
Reviews.Content: it was not expensive., was nice metro within 20 feet, 6 meters. rooms are very clean and well kept. breakfast was good. avoid tours at the counter. green line a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Vote for the President”
Reviews.Author: goldenoldie46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 5 days in October. It is a good base for seeing the sites. The Manzoni metro stop is right outside the hotel so you can get to the Trevi Fountain and other central sites easily. The Roman Christian site seeing bus drops you off a block away at stop No8. Great restuarants but for a quick snack try the bar on the corner. Breakfasts at the hotel can a bit of a scrum but interesting to watch some tour groups using the toaster to cook the salami. Avoid between 7am-8am if you like quiet. Also being Rome you will get a good rest if you ask for a room at the back. I was on the 6th floor and it was quiet. Also if you like to make tea and coffee bring your own. The hotel will provide on request but they do not have enough. Be aware that not all rooms have a safe but you can get a box near reception for a 50euro returnable deposit. Use it there are pickpockets everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced bad service treated like cattle”
Reviews.Author: Trevor S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was given as a Four star Hotel. A night was 195 euros (£168.35) per night which is well over priced for what you get. On arrival was not told that you have to book a reservation in the restaurant to eat in it. Arrived wanting a meal but was refused the restaurant and advised only a bar menu was available... Had to eat out.. the last thing you want when you are tired. The hotel staff were very 'casual' to the point where some of the waiters were unshaven and suffered from halitosis - phew. Just nice when served with food. The rooms were very small, considering what you paid you should have a bit more room. This is a very poor Best Western and does not live up to its name or other Best western Hotels. GO SOME WERE ELSE..

Reviews.Title: “average sums it up”
Reviews.Author: SPG13
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of a tour group and made the mistake of asking for a double room, which gave us a small double bed with about 20 centimetres between one side of the bed and the wall, we believe from others in the group that twin rooms much better. Bar ok price wise and breakfast satisfactory but would it really tax them to bring a pot of decent coffee to the table, rather than providing machines on the buffet of dubious quality and fitful operation. Could not fault cleanliness hats off and tip to the chambermaid. Lifts small and hard to catch at busy times location pretty good but do not think you are close to the main sites other than the Colosseum. The Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi, Piazza Navonna are all a bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel President for three nights and were very impressed. The hotel is clean, the rooms are well-appointed and the staff are very helpful. One teeny criticism is that the bed was quite hard. The location is great, just 10 minutes walk from The Colosseum and has an 'A' line Metro station on the doorstep. When we return to Rome we will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you like a really firm bed!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy W
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay at Hotel President. We liked everything about the place apart from the fact that the beds in our room were much too firm and we woke up with back ache! Also, our double bed was actually two singles pushed together with too much of a noticeable gap between them. That would be the only reason we couldn't stay here again. We found reception courteous, the room super clean, the bathroom very good with nice toiletries replenished daily. Breakfast was very nice with a huge continental selection including plenty of fruits, cereals, breads, cheese, ham etc. The air-conditioning in the room worked well. Our room was a little noisy as it faced onto the main road. We can sleep through general traffic noise but Italians do a fair bit of horn honking and that can wake you up very early! Ask for a courtyard room if you find noise too disturbing. Super handy for the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice average hotel, nothing amazing, nothing awful”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Randomness
Reviews.Content: We just left this hotel after a 4 night stay. Know that as you read this, my husband and I travel a lot, but we're not stuffy, picky people. We're average joe's who don't mind staying in regular run-of-the-mill hotels. If you're looking for a safe bet in a good location without a lot of frills, this is the place. The room was a good size, but not huge. The bathroom was good, although the half glass door didn't contain the water too well and we always ended up with a wet floor. The breakfast was fine. After 4 days of it, we were REALLY ready for something else though. It was the exact same everyday...sometimes different fruit choices. (Avoid the rye bread in little packages at all costs. It was beyond gross!) The free internet was lovely, and it was RIGHT outside the metro station which was super convenient. Its a good 20 minute walk to the Colosseum, although its dubbed as being close to it. Lots of places to eat close by. Employees were fine. One thing to be aware of is that their wake-up call system is messed up. The first morning our wake-up call was right on time. The second morning it never came. Luckily the phone kept ringing in the next room and eventually woke us up. That room got multiple calls that morning. We're pretty sure that was our wake-up call since no one ever answered (empty room?). The third morning the wakeup call was 20 minutes late. And the final morning, it was 8 minutes late. Its an automated call, so I don't know what the problem is. However, if you need to get up at a specific time, bring your own alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok inside, nice location”
Reviews.Author: nextrip101
Reviews.Content: Our room was small. bathroom is nice size, remodeled recently, but shower didn't have tub or glass door, so water was splashing everywhere. Breakfast buffet had choices of cereal, ham, cheese, yogurt, toast, bagels, cream cheese, butter. Plus delicious Italian coffee and other beverages. Taxi ride from the airport fixed price 40euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gymnstic44
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel and were very pleased with the large rooms! The bathroom was also nicely remodeled. The hotel was located right next to a subway station which was very convenient for our stay in Rome. The breakfast that was served daily was never a disapointment. The front desk staff was VERY helpful! They directed us to several delicious restaurants as well as a grocery store (in walking distance) to stock up on much needed water! The room also had a mini fridge which was a plesant surprise! We would stay here again if we ever find ourselves in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just around Subway”
Reviews.Author: salmiero
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just few steps away from subway Manzoni, the staff are excellent, always helpful with guidance and vert friendly, rooms are in good to better shape, bath is very clean and toilettries are one of the best I ever saw in BW's Walking distance from Colosseo, but not short walk) Anyway you are in Rome, whatever else to do? Just walking and seeing the Eternal city, Breakfast is great, sausages, bacon, eggs, fresh juice, it was worth it. The price is very reasonable, btw.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel (and room!) and great strategic location”
Reviews.Author: ekeviny78
Reviews.Content: It took us some time to determine which hotel to stay in Rome.. Essentially we wanted a spot which is convenient (walking distance) to food and transport. The hotel did not disappoint us! There is a very nice Chinese restaurant serving delicious food (reasonably priced!), and other pizzerias nearby. Just right next to hotel, there is underground metro, which was perfect. We were able to plan all the historical sites visitation, and the metro fulfills those, and some savings along the way. Comfortable room, and breakfast. Well managed hotel all in all in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: steve616275
Reviews.Content: just got back and had to write this had wonderful stay at this hotel the room was fantastic well equipped , roomy and very comfortable bed. the staff on the whole were friendly and helpful breakfast was excellent with a variety of choice

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LudmillaMontreal
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic hotel with a great location. The Manzoni metro station is right outside the door, and there is a bus stop 2 blocks away that will take you to most tourist spots. The metro was closed, so we had to take the bus to some places. One warning: bus 85 goes to a lot of the tourist spots, but we took it 4 or 5 times at the same time in the evening, and it went a few different routes. With only a kilometer to the Colosseum, which is then only about 10 minutes away by foot to Piazza Venezia, this hotel is ideally located. As stated by several other guests, the bathrooms have been renovated, so they're quite nice. They really clash with the old rooms, but they're still good and will offer you a clean, safe place to sleep! Breakfast is served until 10:30 and offers a good selection of basics such as yoghurt, cereals, eggs, bread, meat and cheese. However, they're not of the greatest quality, but they will fill you up! I'm not certain how much this hotel would charge per night as we bought packages that included the flight, airport transfers and 7 night stay at the hotel. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's location is close enough for a leisurely stroll to the Colosseum, there is a good number of cafes nearby, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: HandMBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very useful location right next to the Metro, and walking distance to many attractions. Our room was generally clean and tidy, but soundproofing wasn't good as we could hear people walking up and down the corridor at night. We arrived early (10am ), and fortunately our room was ready for us. The staff at the front desk were also very helpful and patient. After three or four nights the breakfast becomes a little boring due to the limited choices. As the hotel caters for tour groups, you might want to avoid the morning stampede.

Reviews.Title: “Good position in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: max4u
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel is in the city centre, you can easily reach it: it is near the underground station and in the area you can find parking sites quite easily if you have a car (quite amazing if you consider the traffic in Rome). As it is not far from a big police station, you shouldn't worry much about car stealing or getting back late at night. The room was clean, but not too big. As I asked for a high floor, it was not noisy, though in the city centre and on a busy road. The buffet breakfast was various and quite good. The staff was helpful and nice. The only problem was with the internet connection: neither the cable line nor the wi-fi was working properly, so I had to go to the lobby where there is an internet corner. As I was already charged the internet fee though it was not working, I was offered to use the internet corner for free.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Rebel-Yell-Chicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the President Hotel for a three-day business trip in early July and found the hotel to be clean, quiet and inexpensive. I had a double room for single use, and it was quite small, so I can't imagine how small a single room would be. My room faced away from the front of the hotel, which is on a major street and is quite noisy, so I recommend asking for a room facing away from the highway. The bathroom has been recently renovated and was quite clean. It has a shower and bidet. There is complementary internet access and a buffett breakfast was included in the price of my room. The internet worked fine and the buffett was adequate, what you expect for "free." There is a restaurant and bar on the lobby level but I didn't eat there. I did, however, get some ice cubes from the bar; there is no ice machine as you would expect in Europe. One of Rome's two subway lines has a station literally at the front door of the hotel, so you can take he subway from the main railway station (two stops I think) to the hotel and save hiring a taxi. From the hotel, it is about a ten-minute walk to the Colosseum and ruins. All in all, I was quite happy with the value of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Maja_travelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favourites hotel in the world.....it is a lovely hotel....the rooms are amazing...very comfortable....very clean...it has FREE WIFI Internet...the stuff is wonderful and very helpful.....u can have the maps of Rome...the location is perfect ...close to the metro....the food is really delicious... I LOVE YOU BEST WESTERN PRESIDENT Hotel... and i am gonna be back there next month....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: caz1205
Reviews.Content: The Manzoni metro stop is right outside the hotel, which is great for exploring the city. The hotel was nice, my room was perhaps a little dated, but the bathroom with shower was great and the bed was very comfortable. The room service and restaurant has a very limited menu so I ate out - when in Rome, as they say!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located. Good base for seeing all sights”
Reviews.Author: Baclava
Reviews.Content: Not the smartest hotel, although our bedroom was huge and the bathrooms have all been re-furbished. Good workable aircon which we needed as the temperature was 40 deg. Takes Japanese and Korean tour groups so breakfast was a bit hairy, but nevertheless managable. Not all rooms seem to have safes. Biggest draw for the hotel is its accessability to all major sites due to its position above Manzoni metro station, which gets you to the Spanish steps, Vatican, and Colisseum very easily. Buses to all areas pass by outside.

Reviews.Title: “Train or Walk?”
Reviews.Author: rubencanobra
Reviews.Content: I organised a School group of 35 Australians that stayed here on 10/4/11 to 13/4/11. Make sure you arrive no earlier than 2pm, but aside from that, service was spectacular from every person here, they bent over backwards to make our stay comfortable including providing advice on where to go and what to see. Perfect location with a supermarket 2 blocks away, a laundromat about 5 blocks away and street markets on Mondays about 5 blocks to the right of the hotel. Rooms were clean and spacious. Dining was high quality as was their breakfast and they had no problems adjusting meal times for such a large group. I would definitely stay here again ,the subway is 20 metres away and we even walked to Termini station and all the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Loverly location for a site seeing”
Reviews.Author: PAJAWALES
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a package holiday with Riviera Travel. It was a well organised holiday with excellent trips and Reps/Guides. The hotel was well located for the Colosseum and the Metro next door for travelling further. It was in a safe area with shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel itself was well above average. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the bathroom and shower were a womans dream. Free tea/coffee making facility are available in your room on request at reception. The air con was very efficient with outside temperature 33 'C. The public areas and bars again were very comfortable. The continental breakfast was also well above average. I would highly recomend a resaurant for evening meal after a hard day sightseeing. It is the La Taverna de L Re ( was called Mamma Mia) 52/54 Viale Manzoni. It is the road directly opposite the entrance to the hotel about 5 mins walk. The food was of high quality,and you do not pay more for chips/salad as in the other restaurants. The service and waiters were first class and the price very reasonable....9 euro for 1 litre of good quality wine. Enjoy Rome....it is a fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and Adequate”
Reviews.Author: malcliz
Reviews.Content: We agree with others who have said in their reviews that the hotel is closer to 3 stars, than 4. Our room was quite small and dark although the bathroom was very modern with a very good shower, so perhaps that had been renovated. Our room was on the road side and was quite noisy during the night. The pillows were very lumpy which seemed strange as there was a pillow menu on the bed so presumably we could have asked for something more comfortable! We did have a mini bar in the room and flat screen TV and safe but we didn’t have coffee and tea making facilities which other reviewers have mentioned. A great plus point was free Wifi. You had to get a new code every day from reception in order to access this. The breakfast was quite good and for such a crowded hotel it was impressive how they kept the tables cleared and food choices topped up during the breakfast hours. There is a café/bar where you can have dinner but this needs to be booked before 2 pm but there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Our room wasn’t ready when we arrived in the morning but on the plus side we didn’t have to vacate until 12 noon on our last day. There are 2 rather old fashioned lifts which were nearly always full or with people waiting which was a nuisance as we were on the 5th floor – we gave up and walked up 5 floors once – a long way up! In summary, adequate for a short city stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just another average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jj15951
Reviews.Content: The only plus to this hotel was that the bathrooms were recently all renovated. Very nice. The rooms are in desperate need of renovations (especially the mattresses and pillows). Pillows were literally so old they were rocks. The sheets were also yellowing on the edges. At least the hotel offers a 'pillow menu' so that you can try to change your pillow to a more comfortable one. Maid service also was horrible. We had to call nightly to get new towels (as the maid would take our towels but never give us new ones). Breakfasts were average for italy. Nothing to write home about. Front desk staff was amazing though. Very helpful. Free wifi was also much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further. Clean, Modern, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: RobinCas
Reviews.Content: After spending numerous hours researching hotels in Rome, and reading so many negative reviews about so many hotels i can say the following about this hotel: 1. Brillant location, right near the metro station Mazoni. Makes all parts of the city accessable, plus it is a safe well lit part of town late at night. 2. The room was modern, clean with a great shower 3. Breakfast was more than i expected. The staff continued to replenish the fruit, bacon and eggs, coffee and juice, cereals and bread right through to 10.30am. 4. The staff at reception where friendly and helpful. very professional and always at the ready to help. 5. Best hotel at this price range. Remember Rome is about seeing the sights not living in a hotel room but you need a hotel staffed with people who help with directions, is clean and comfortable and allows you to sleep well and recharge your energy level after a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Locational advantage”
Reviews.Author: sanjay_datta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conviniently located just outside the Manzoni metro station. From Termini train station go down to A line Metro and board the metro. Get down at Manzoni station. It is well connectted with every part of Rome.The famous "colosseum" is only 10 minutes walking from the hotel. Rooms are just big enough to accomodate 1 double bed and 1 single bed , a sofa and a table.The rooms are well lit. The facilities like tea coffee maker and free wifi connection ( even they allowed us to takle print out of our boardinng pass free of cost) provided are rare to find in europe. Staffs are very helpful and provided useful information on sightseeing.. The city maps provided by the hotel is very informative and tourist can use this for spotting any important tourist spots. The biggest surprise is the city tax @ Euro 3/person per night which we were not aware.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect -- But Good Location and Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonjoncapy
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday with a group of adults and teenagers from our church from Rome and as far as I can tell, everyone had a great time... I've been to Rome a few times before and this hotel is probably the best one I've stayed so far. It's no Marriott and it's small -- but unless you're willing to pay a couple of hundred dollars a night for a hotel room, this hotel should serve your needs... The hotel rooms, by European/Roman standard, is actually quite nice and has all the basic necessities. My side of the hotel was very quiet and I had no noisy neighbors. Some people from my group however who were on the street side of the hotel complained about police and ambulance noises every 15 minutes (perhaps the hotel can install sound proof windows?) -- although this is not something we can fault the hotel -- it's just Rome! Perhaps the biggest complaint I got from the adults and teens alike were the noises from the other guests -- there were several student groups and the days we were there, a group of Mexican girls were uncontrollable and extremely disrespectful of the other guests. Our chaperones and some of our teens complained to the front desk and the people at the desk were very rude to them. This was unnecessary. As the group leader and chaperone myself, I know that if a guest complained about one of my kids, i would have reprimanded them and dealt with their lack of courtesy. The hotel staff should have contacted their chaperones or adult leaders and demanded that the situation be addressed. And as I've said, the rudeness of the receptionist to our adults and kids was completely unnecessary... we're not blaming the staff for the problem, but they do not need to be rude. I was also told that when one of my kids asked for an access code for the internet from the front desk person, he was told "I already gave you one!" Again, be a little professional. Even though they are kids they paid good money to stay in your hotel. No need to be irritated. Most of the staff however were very respectful and kind -- the kitchen staff were very accommodating to our group since we had a couple of people with dietary restrictions. I want to thank them personally for their good service. Most of the staff on the front desk were very kind and helpful. The accessibility of the hotel bar with drinks and food is also good especially if you want late snacks... The location of the hotel is excellent -- the metro is literally outside the hotel entrance and has access to all the major sites, there are a few stores and restaurants close by for evening walks and to purchase things, and it's about a 15 minute walk to the Coloseum where there are other good places to eat and shop. If you're traveling with a group or even on your own -- this hotel is not a bad place to stay. It's clean, decent, and has many pluses. Again, consider that most of the complaints from my group were beyond the hotel's control -- except that they could have handled certain things differently and the rudeness of some of the front desk staff was completely unnecessary. Most of the staff were helpful and courteous -- some people from my group had some problems and requests and they took care of it immediately -- safe getting jammed, getting stuck in the elevator, etc -- kudos to the maintenance crew. Overall it's a good place and if you need a place to stay while you're touring Rome, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Addict_3_10
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, a very good hotel (a little bit cold as they didn't have heat available and he had some chilly nights, but we had blankets), very clean. We really appreciated Barbara's help from the front desk. She was very nice, spoke very good English, was truly helpful with everything that we asked (and we asked for help several times). The subway is in front of the hotel, you can walk to the Coloseum and you can have great pasta at the restaurant next to the hotel, great pizza a taglo from a pizza place very near and also try the ice cream from the casa del gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Terrible front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Suzyz40
Reviews.Content: Hotel was surprisingly wonderful! Great breakfast! Location is fair but the front desk staff was very rude and that would keep us away from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a metro stop”
Reviews.Author: jazzjunkysue
Reviews.Content: On the outside it looks dated but the interior is all new and lovely. Big marble bath, easy to open windows, especially in the bath. Huge buffet breakfast included. Get a room over the courtyard: Quieter than a street view. Nice neighborhood, not near the termini train station. That neighborhood makes me really really nervous. I felt completely comfortable coming and going in this neighborhood at all hours. And there's a great cafe right downstairs, with everything from pastry and cappucino to full sit down meals. Ok it's not gourmet but it's open late and the owners are alot of fun. Great port in a storm. I'll stay there again. The front desk help is professional, speaks great english and gives great advice. Good price, too.

Reviews.Title: “location, location , location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carmel83
Reviews.Content: Great location with this hotel! Metro stop right outside (Manzoni). However taxis are cheapish back from any where in Rome! Only thing i would say is watch which taxi you get into. Some taxi's will charge you extra (5e) just because theyre a different firm. Hotel is within walking distance from a good few places. Just remember good walking shoes! Rooms were abit small, but very comfy! Beds, very comfy! Bathrooms, very clean and LOVELY shower after a long day of walking! Overall the rooms was very clean! Rooms cleaned every day! Very helpful staff!! Lovely breakfeast every morning! We went to see City on the first day, got a DLT tour bus! very cheap I thought (16e after 1) stops at the major sites. Hop on Hop off, ever half hr! We went to see the Pope. Would recommend this, a site worth seeing! But Pre-Book! I booked through viator.com. Had a lovely guide and got us great seats!! Be watchful when in Termini station at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: PaulFowler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum and Termini, with a Metro station right on the front door step. We stay for 5 nights and could not beleive the value for money this property represents. The rooms are very comfortable, well appointed and in good condition with the staff friendly and helpful, which is not nessacarily standard in Italy. We ate breakfast in the hotel each morning and enjoyed the quite bar in the evenings. As a couples or family hotel we would highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Billarion
Reviews.Content: Very good location next to metro line! Friendly staff and relatively cheap! I'll certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Pathin
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location - right next to Manzoni metro station which is 2 stops away from the Termini Station. Another advantage, it is only a short walk of 10 mins to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum from the hotel. A no. of pizzerias, a chinese restaurant, a couple of super markets within close vicinity provide ample options for dinner/lunch. The hotel breakfast is adequate, coffee (as is expected in Italy) is plentiful. Rooms are good, but definitely not four star! Bathrooms leave a lot to be desired. Staff were attentive and friendly. In conclusion, a perfectly adequate place to rest your body when the focus is seeing and experiencing the sights of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good location!”
Reviews.Author: fatcat2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days from 30 Oct 2010 to 1 Nov 2010. The room was clean, of a good size and the bed was very comfortable. Location wise, it was very near the subway, literally a stone's throw away. Reception/Conceirge and service was acceptable. Breakfast was pretty decent with a choice of bread, buns, some cured meats, fruits and cereals. I booked the hotel through wotif.com and got a fair price for it. Definitely recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: sefarebsb
Reviews.Content: It is not a 4 star hotel, probably a 3 star. The hotel is rather decaying, but breakfast is good. For all it offers, it could be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: BaySecks
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient to most tourist attractions and is steps away from a subway line. All of the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was adequate, it was your typical continental breakfast. The rooms were clean but plain. The bathroom layout was poor and the shower stall was tiny, I could barely fit in it to use it. The free internet connection was a bonus. You must use the connection in the room, wifii not free. Overall I'd rate this an excellent value hotel. If all you need is a quiet, comfortable bed to sleep in this is the hotel you should use.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and at a good location for tourism”
Reviews.Author: Shweta_ch
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband and family to Rome for tourism and finding a good and reasonably priced hotel seemed like a problem initially. But later we found this nice hotel. clean, good service, nice breakfast. plus there was a deal, one night free if u stay 3 nights( weekend offer). the hotel is quite close to termini station, Colosseum and some nice piazzas. alll in all i would say worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “whatever they say, great location”
Reviews.Author: ersinyx
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay in Rome for two nights and picked up that hotel after a little search on the rome map. There's a metro station just a few foot away form hotel's entrance. Well, we only used the metro to reach the center terminal bus&train station and it's just two stops away. We walked to the Collesium whick took 7-8 minutes. As you'll realise the Rome city center is so small that you can walk to every attraction while they're only minutes of walk away from eachother. I mean the hotel location is more than enough, great. Hotel rooms are are reasonably big and roomy. We loved the perfectly designed showers, I am sure you'll love them, as well. Air conditioning and cleanliss are again more than enough for a 4* hotel. Well let me tell you the bad things: We stayed in a triple room, well, the third bed was not a bed actually, it was a kinda sofa, so sorry for the triple visitors. The second and last bad thing is breakfast, it's almost nothing, I ate much better ones at 3* hotels. As a last word, I can't skip the helpful staff. They were so kind and helpful to us, and I will probably pick that hotel again if I visit Rome, well not triple but double:]

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great value and a good place”
Reviews.Author: lhuddles
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. It is literally right next to the metro stop, so it is wonderful if you will be using the metro for anything. The room I stayed in was spacious, clean, and had a very Americanized feel to it. Additionally the bathroom was not cramped and very clean. The air conditioning kept our room cold at night, and we loved having breakfast delivered to our room for free. The breakfast spread is an additional plus: cappuccino, chocolate, croissant, fruit, eggs, ham, tea, orange juice, etc. You can also select a time for it to be delivered, which was wonderful. My stay here was wonderful, and I would definitely stay here again if I were to come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Donna94605
Reviews.Content: Very good location for using public transportation to get around Rome, very helpful staff, extensive and tasty breakfast, and excellent air conditioning. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Berniebobcat
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel President by default recently, as the Hotel that we had booked originally did not have space for us. On the first night, we were late arriving due to the mix up at the Hotel Latinum, and consequently when we asked for the staff to move us to a quiet room away from the front of the hotel it was not possible. I must admit that despite the street noise when we checked into the room (there seemed to be ambulances passing by our room every 10 minutes!) we actually slept very well, as the bed was very comfortable, and there were no sirens used by the ambulances after midnight. The staff gave us a room at the back of the hotel on our second night, and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in anywhere in the world! The bathrooms in both rooms were very modern and well equipped. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was excellent, the location was wonderful as we front door was literally 20 metres from the Metro entry. At €100 for B&B for two, I think that this hotel is excellent value and I would certainly recommend it to friends. The only criticism that I would have (aside from the house in the rooms overlooking the main road) would be the quality of the "carpet" tiles. When I say carpet, the tiles appeared to be made out of twisted rope, and it did give the floors a bit of a downbeat appearance. Similarly, the sofas in the bar looked like a throwback from the 70's, and they were certainly not designed to encourage guests to lounge about for hours at a time. All said though, the most important criteria were covered in this hotel. It is centrally located, it is clean and comfortable and it offers excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: anna32Greece
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean, a bit small but it had it all. The location of the hotel is its best point. On the metro station!!, you can be anywhere you want and back. You can also walk from most of the sightseeings (about 20min walk) (10min.max walk from the Colosseum). The bouffet was very good. The reception service was a bit poor but nothing to be alarmed about. In all i would recommend this hotel for

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that Best Western Forgot.”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: The amount of challenges one could talk about with this so called branch of Best Western Hotels is a joke and one visit to this branch of Best Western (my only Best Western visit) has been enough for me never to patron the group again, anywhere. Best Western clearly has a control problem with the staff here (all of the staff) who seam not to care that they are serving paying guests and that they are the so called ambassadors of Best Western, or maybe I'm wrong as going by the: Management response from Direzione_President, The Management to thetraveller2010 dated 21 April 2010 signed by Cinzia/Booking Department Best Western Hotel President Roscioli Hotels Group - Rome. Featured below in faint text, and I quote. "We can assure you that our staff is usually very polite and helpful to all our guests, they surely not need to learn good manners and customer care skills, this can be easily verified reading all the customers reviews on the Best Western web site which, at the contrary of what you declare, praise the particular attention and kindness that our reception staff devotes to our clients". Again I quote. "they surely not need to learn good manners and customer care skills" Maybe this is as polite and accommodating as any employee of Best Western can be and they all should be honored, with this kind of attitude from Senior Management no wonder they have lost control of Best Western President Hotel staff. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “only 1klm from collosseum but inconsistent and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: paolaedavide
Reviews.Content: our last 2 nights in rome were a disapointment due to this hotel. we had stayed in 15 different hotels on our trip, and can speak Italian, and this was the most expensive and delivered the least. the staff were inconsistent and we were told different information by 3 different staff members, and they became rude after our toilet broke in the middle of the night and we asked for our 2 drinks and WIFI ( $7 for 24hrs) to be complimentary due to the fact we could not use the toilet from 12midnight until checkout! .

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience never mind arrivederci Roma..How about arrivederci President!”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel very recently for work, best thing about it is it's central position to the Colosseo and the Metro. Reception staff VERY rude, arrogant and most unhelpful, you'd think you were doing them a favour by staying there and not the other way around. Room was tiny with a small single bed, asked to upgrade to a bigger room and pay the difference, didn't even get a reply just a look which said it all. You can order different types of pillows for your bed which is a nice touch and when I did this they did get delivered promptly. I am fluent in Italian and I have to say those guys on reception put Italians to shame. - shame on you learn some manners and customer service skills! Hotel restaurant was fine although they skimp on your portions so I wouldn't eat there if I was you, far better places to eat and your only 600 metres away from the Colluseumn, turn left outside the hotel and left again at the end of the street corner past the metro station and walk straight down. On the plus side must admit the two waiters on duty were both great and really aimed to please - good on you! breafast was fine, plenty to choose from, bacon, eggs and coninental, waiters again work hard and are great. For the money there are far better hotels to stay in thank god I stayed only one night and it will be a night best forgotten as I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunshintuna
Reviews.Content: I don't really know if I would call interesting good ro bad, just interesting. I picked this hotel because it was on the same street as a friends apartment, and not being from Italy or speaking Italian, I wanted somewhere close to my friends place. As well, I also had a cold, so it was nice to be able to relax for a bit. I suppose it is because I am North American, but I have never stayed in a smaller room, even in New York City. Also, the room had 2 twin beds, which didnt bother me, I was by myself. I meglected to read the key envelope telling you how to turn on the lights, so I stood in the room for a few minutes before I needed to get someone. I was able to find a staff person that spoke English and he showed me what to do. My air conditioner never worked, and the view of a courtyard below was not great, but with the window open, I was fine. It took me a while to figure out how to work the blinds, but once I did, I thought that it was great. There are only 4 english channels on the tv and 2 are news channels. I opted for the unlimited pay per view which, for me, was great. The internet in the room didnt work, but they had a computer in the lobby so that was fine. The staff there spoke English for the most part, so communication was easy. The elevators were unique. Only one of the two ever worked. One had a door that you pulled open then got into the elevator then the sliding doors closed. You then pushed the door open to get out. The breakfast buffet was good, I was never hungry. There were lots of options. If in Rome again, I would definitely stay here, though not if I was with a group.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable,clean but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Julie2903
Reviews.Content: I have no real criticism of this hotel. It was a place to sleep and the breakfast buffet was adequate but to I think it may be stretching a point to call it 4 star. The rooms were cleaned everyday with fresh towels and bedding. Outlook from window was into a rather dismal courtyard and the room was very warm and although we adjusted the air conitioning it made little difference so I didn't have the best nights sleep. Walking distance to Colosseum and a metro station right outside which we used to get to vatican which would have been just a little too far to walk comfortably and found a great restaurant just 5 mins away (Merulan) which used to eat in each night of our 3 night stay. I would highly recommend a visit to Rome and we would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Dizabeth
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean but my room was on the second floor facing the street and traffic noise was very bad. If you make sure your room is away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay here!”
Reviews.Author: StubStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Stayed just down the road from this hotel and whilst it was raining went in here for some refreshment only to be told by the concierge that the facilities were only for hotel guests. Even though there was a great big BAR sign outside! Why would you want to put someone off your Hotel before they had even stepped foot in the place?

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kmike612
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel President was good value for the money. Perfect location. The entrance to the hotel was literally steps away from the subway Marzoni Line A stop. It made it simple to get around Rome. My room was small, bathroom was decent sized, and it was just me it was perfect. Everything was very clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Best Western Hotels Do NOT Provide Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: VacationBug8
Reviews.Content: We were reviewing the Hotel President Rome through the Best Western website and made a reservation for a 3 night stay. Somehow the reservation was kicked to a third party portal who did not send us an email confirmation. We tried to cancel the reservation (location of hotel is bad) and the code we had didn't work. We called Best Western and they couldn't find any reservation for us in their system or at the hotel's. We just returned from our trip and now have a no-show charge for the hotel we tried to cancel. The Best Western and Hotel President staff will provide no assistance in resolving this issue. BEWARE of using the Best Western web for reservations and, more importantly, BEWARE of using any Best Western hotel ... they obviously don't value guests enough to worry about repeat business!

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the President Hotel in Rome after ariving at our pre booked hotel and finding that it was awful and we didn't want to stay there. So we were driving around Rome wondering where the hell to stay when we passed the President and seen the four stars and went inside to see if they had a room for us. The staff were friendly and accommodating. We paid more than our budget to stay here but were willing to pay it to stay in a decent hotel after seeing our original one! Our room was fabulous! It had internet connection and hige choice of pay pe view films. It was nice to watch TV in English for a change after lots of Italian only channels in previous Italian hotels we had stayed out before arriving in Rome. It had a beautiful clean bathroom, HUGE really, really comfy bed and was modern, brightly decorated and cosy. It was also in a great location - just 15 minutes from the Colloseum and 10 minutes from the Sightseeing tourbus bus stop. Breakfast was great - lots and lots of choice - ham, cheese, eggs, bacon and sausage with pancakes, croissants, bread rolls, fruit, yoghurt and a wide choice of drinks inclouding three juices, cappuccino, espresso, latte, hot chocolate. It was great. It was also near to an ice cream shop, souvenir shop, three restaurants and a fab cocktail bar which were all within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Overall this hotel was fab and really comfortable to stay in. I would recommend it for a comfortable, luxury, deent stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Sudipta_Sinha
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hotel. I have been there in June 2009. The area is obviously not the Historical area of Rome but very close to Colosseum and Roman Forum. I found it very convenient as it is just few steps from Manzoni metro and also easy to commute to Roma Termini station and Airport. The staffs are well mannered, friendly and helpful, particularly the lady named Barbara. They have a good choice of hot and continental breakfast. The rooms are comfortable and cleaned; however, as I found in all European hotels, the rooms are small. Just one tip, you won’t find much of the typical restaurants in this area, however, there are plenty of Pizzerias and snack bars. It is a good choice overall and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Steinbrenner
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just O.K. Location is near the Metro and the breakfast was good. We had one room that us updated and it was nice. I would not recommed this hotel to families. It is to far from all the main attractions in Rome. However, if you are going on business and just needed to go from place to place vai theMetro it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “super location+ breakfast, poor room”
Reviews.Author: popgr
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the hotel in April 2009 for four nights. The hotel is amazingly close to the metro station ''manzoni'' , just in front of the entrance, very convenient for transportation to the city and airport! Our room , a double, faced bakyards to opposite buildings,was very small in comparison to other rooms in the same floor which faced the front of the hotel. The furniture was very simple, old, and dark. When we returned to the hotel, after all day walking, we would have really liked to be in a better environment than this small , dark room. During our stay, the bed was set every day , but the sheets were not changed at all during our 4 night stay, only towels were changed daily. The bathroom was also small, but it was very nice and clean (seemed recently refurnished, contrary to the bedroom). The breakfast was splendid. Served from 6.30 until 10.30, it included everything you can expect from a 4 star hotel, (even various sliced fresh fruits),enough to keep you going for the day !

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: vacations2xayear
Reviews.Content: nice property, great location, some rooms could stand a makeover but nothing serious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for visting Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kitty099
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the President Hotel 26-29 January 2009, my husband and I had taken my mother to Rome for her 70th birthday, so we had a mix of travellers from mid 30's to mid 70's. We booked the flights and hotel via Easyjet and although worried about the standard of the hotel due to the price, we were plesantly surprised. It was clean and tidy which is all you could ask from what was purely used as a sightseeing base. My husband and I had a room on the 1st floor looking into a courtyard. The room was a good size and quiet. My mother and her friend shared a road facing room on the 5th floor and although they did experience noise (workmen working though the night) it did not disturb them too much. I was very impressed that the hotel when we arrived swapped a double room for a twin room at short notice even though I had mistakenly booked a double room for my Mum and her companion (two widowed ladies). It was a perfect location for touring Rome, however I would suggest against booking the Grey Line Tours hop on/hop off bus from reception. We did book it and they did not seem as regular (or have as many buses on route) as other tour companies!! There are plenty of plaes to eat within walking distance of the hotel (turn left or right out of the hotel and within 5 mins you will reach a number of restuarants). All in all we really enjoyed our stay in Rome and I would not hesitate to use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Really convenient”
Reviews.Author: jinman72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the President for 3 nights in September 2008 and found it extremely convenient for the "Metro" railway station of Manzoni. The station steps are literally a dozen paces from the front door of the hotel, giving easy access by public transport to the various sights around the city. Inside the hotel itself, we found the staff on the reception desk to be very knowledgable and helpful, also the breakfasts were adequate for our needs, and the hotel was in good order, very clean and the room was ideal in both size and facilities. The only (minor) problem was the shower cubicle which was a little cramped , a "wide" person would have difficulty in using it. Would definitely stay at the President again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: nianchen99
Reviews.Content: We joined Globus for a 15 day Italy-Greece tour. Hotel President was the first hotel we stayed which was a bad beginning of the tour. The location of the hotel was convenient, but everything else was lousy. Rooms were terribly noisy and staff was rude. The source of their business was obviousely from tour companies. They don't care about how their guests feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhanick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there May 30-June 15 2008. The hotel itself is "ok". The staff can be described as unhelpful at best. Had issues with internet and didn't get a wake up call when asked for it on a crucial night when we had to catch a train the next morning. Breakfast was ok. Nothing fancy. Powdered eggs, fruit, danishes, bacon/sausage and juice/milk. The Manzoni station opened up again so it's convenient to get around from the hotel. The inside of the hotel is dingy and old. The elevator is about the 3x3 feet, very small old style. The service staff did a good job of cleaning up everyday. The most redeeming quality of this hotel is its location. It's close to all the major sites. It's a good place to flop after a long day of sight seeing but that makes it a 2 star hotel at best, not 3-4 star as they claim. I submitted a survey through BestWestern and had the owner reply to me apologizing for the issues however most of the problems I had were ones that have already been talked about in reviews so I doubt anything will be done to correct the issues I had.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review for sure”
Reviews.Author: martinDY
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the President over a dozen times in the last 15 years with my groups. The front desk service depends who you are and who is there, and the same can be said of the restaurant staff- the attention I received was haphazard until after 3-4 stays, they realized that I was the one with the tip money for our group- then, surprise! I was treated with reverence and respect. The restaurant is good for breakfast (except for those really weird hollow rolls that resemle bizarrely deformed nipples!), but dinners are best elsewhere; the rooms are fairly random, from decent sized to tiny (my room last time was small enough that at the foot of the bed I could touch three walls. Best to get a room on the inside courtyard, because street rooms get a lot of street noise. One of the bar men is quite good humoured and very helpful. Showers frequently mouldy as are shower curtains, and the hotel seems to be under perpetual remodelling, so there's plenty of dust. The Manzoni metro station was out of service nearly 3 years, but I'm glad to hear it has reopened- that helps a lot, since that subway line takes you to Spagna & Termini as well as the Vatican. Colosseum is an easy walk away, very nice gelato place just to the right of the hotel (as you exit the front door), and a fabulous tiny pizza place called Sicilia in La Bocca- say hello to Carmine, the owner (turn right out the front door, about 100 metres up).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: Deni D
Reviews.Content: Our group of 14 stayed at this property in March. We came to Rome by train from Venice and arrived at 2000h. Leaving the station and seeing the immediate neighborhood we were very concerned because it appeared 'on the edge' but when we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. This is a budget-style hotel and has tour buses of Asian and American groups using it. Our rooms were too hot but just opening the window and turning off the heat corrected that. Some were concerned because it appeared there was mold onb the wall in their room- management quickly moved them without issue. Breakfast was more than adequate but they do cut it off at 1000 (it was included in our rate). There is a small shop on the corner for sandwiches, a fruitaria around the corner along with an ATM across from the fruitaria.The Metro stop is steps away from the door of the hotel. Would I stay here again? Yes. Is it worth it? For Americans with our falling dollar-YES!

Reviews.Title: “4 stars! No way! 1 or 2 stars max!”
Reviews.Author: derekgorman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was advertised as a 4 star hotel but they must be joking....the room was dirty...so i asked for another and it was bigger but still dirty! As for the showers...the shower heads weren't adjustable and i am 6 foot tall (1.8m) so i'm hardly a freak of nature but i had to crouch down just to take a shower!! Never in all my life have i experienced this... The location is good but AVOID THIS PLACE. It is NOT 4 star quality and should not be advertised as such. I think there must be a very lax hotel star rating.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: basheens
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were only in Rome for two days from the 28th Sept 07 and wanted the best possible location to see everything. We definitely picked the right hotel. Within 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum. The staff were so helpful and friendly. They gave us great advice on how best to plan our two days. The room was huge. We couldn't believe it. The bathroom was very clean. Towels were changed every day. We really couldn't have asked for anywhere better. Would definitly recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness and reasonably price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - maybe 1 star”
Reviews.Author: tjredva
Reviews.Content: Hello, Just got back from a quick stay in Rome at the Hotel President. Absolutely terrible hotel. We walked into the lobby to find dirty couches and chairs and a grumpy front desk manager. Our room was small, dark and dirty. The bathroom was a joke. We were jolted awake at 7:45am with the massive construction (jackhammering) going on outside our window. Excited to get out of our room for breakfast to find warm milk and ceral. The handy metro right outside was closed and the neighborhood offered nothing but construction and noise. If you have booked this hotel I would cancel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gunc
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel last minute and this was the only hotel that we can find near historic center. The location was OK, near to common sites. But, when we entered the hotel, we faced with a long que of people waiting to be checked in. The receptionist was working hard but there should be more people working on the reception desk, not just one. The hotel is really old! the reception area was small and feels like you were in 80's.The elevators were also old and we had some problems so if you have children, you should be carefull. The room was small, and also feels like 80's. The bathroom was big but old again, with a shower curtain that seems to be there for ages. The bathrooms must be renewed immediately. Although the room was clean and the room service was doing a good jod, I felt that the room was dirty since the room was old. The brakfast was worst ever in Italy. We have paid 150 euros per room / per night. But there was a list in the reception and we saw the prices vary from 40 Euros to 200 Euros for the same rooms for the same night. Compared to the quality of the service and the rooms the real worth of the stay should not be more than 60 euros per day. I do not recommend this hotel if you are supposed to pay more than 60 Euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “President hotel- hate it!”
Reviews.Author: Iulia17
Reviews.Content: I hate this hotel, is not a 4 stars hotel! The room and the bathroom were very, very small! I wiil never come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgjohnson
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money and only 10 - 15 minute walk from the Coleseum. Very high Quality rooms and it definetly lives up to a 4 star hotel. There is a tube station located right outside the hotel for ease of travelling around Rome. Only down side I would say was the traffic noise !! However when you have walked around Rome all day and drunk the wine etc... you will get a good night sleep anyway. We noticed the noise more in the morning. Would definately recommend and the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Perdido
Reviews.Content: After looking @ Frommers, Foders, Rick Steves I didn't see a recommendation for this hotel. I was on an educational trip with 25 students and adults OUTSIDE the city of Rome, but my husband and son wanted to stay near the Colliseum. They got EXACTLY what they wanted. The directions the hotel gives out are EASY to follow and the COST is cheap versus taking a cab. The hotel is convenient and the management is VERY nice. The breakfast is absolutely FANTASTIC. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It is a GREAT value. We paid $106 Euro and it dropped even more and is now $91. Orginally I booked @ $240, but as the price dropped I rebooked. You won't be disappointed, if location is your primary concern. It is a GREAT hotel and is a bargain for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “worst restaurant ever”
Reviews.Author: a85simpsop
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of an email I sent to the hotel.. they haven't replied ..what does that say ?? I am writing regarding a recent stay at your hotel on 20th – 23rd May 2007. We have stayed at many Best Westerns throughout the UK and New York. The standard of the bedroom we had and the hotel in general was very good. However I can honestly say that the restaurant was the worst we have ever encountered in ANY hotel. The staff in the restaurant were very rude, not only to us but to other guests entering the restaurant. We booked half board accommodation and on the first night we asked at reception regarding the evening meal. The gentleman on reception didn’t speak much English but told us we had to go in with the group, we told him we were not with a group, we had booked individually, he didn’t seem to understand so another gentlemen intervened, he said I will take you through to the restaurant and we were met by the waiter. He showed us our table near the door and we ordered two drinks, he said “Lasagne”, not a question, but a statement. We said OK, but what we got was pasta and cheese sauce, quite frankly I have seen better microwave meals! Even another waiter asked me what I was eating and I told him they said Lasagne, he said it doesn’t look like that to me. Anyway, the next course got better, one pork chop, burnt green beans and four soggy croquette potatoes. I said I didn’t want a sweet and the waiter offered fruit salad. He then brought me a dish full of fruit that had seen better days and threw a knife at me. Whilst we were eating our meal the staff were more concerned with fussing round the coach parties that were in at the same time and we seemed to be an inconvenience to them. The reception staff asked us about the meal and we said it was not very good at all. They told us it would be better the next night. When we came in the following afternoon we asked at reception about the choice as stated in your hotel service directory which says “you can choose from the a la carte menu, the days menu or the Mediterranean menu”. We were told that there was no choice but they would allow us to have pork chop or veal or a combination of both. When we went down for the meal we were given for starters pasta in tomato sauce, to be quite honest I think tinned pasta may have been better! We were asked what we wanted for the main course and we both said veal. I asked for salad and my wife asked for vegetables. When it arrived we had three pieces of veal in an insipid sauce and were both given two plates of lettuce – one variety only. They asked us if we wanted a sweet and we said no and left. We again complained at reception and said that we would be eating out the following night, as we completely thought that enough was enough. When we went out for our evening the following night at 7.45pm we noted that the restaurant was in darkness! I note that your hotel services directory states that “you have the advantage of staying at individually run hotels with the benefit of strict quality standards certified every year by independent inspectors”. I do not think this is the case here! I feel that some sort of recompense should be made to us as we would never ever have booked half board if we had known the standard, and to be quite honest the whole episode ruined the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: aliChesterfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 23rd to 26th Feb 2007. Not a bad hotel for the price. Excellent location, within an easy walk of some main attractions and the metro station. The metro right outside the hotel is closed at the moment but there are 2 other metro stations within approx 750 metres either up or down hill from the hotel. The staff were friendly but very s l o w.... and breakfast was ok with a good choice. Our room was a very small double. If we were offered a choice again we would pick a twin room as the twin rooms are larger .
