The shower curtain in the bathroom was very annoying as it did not stay in the shower tray resulting in a very wet bathroom floor. But the room was clean and quiet as we had a room facing an internal courtyard. The hotel bar was very cheap! We would stay again, but select a larger room. Ali and Darcy David

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: conatyfamily
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel from feb. 14-17.location was ideal.staff could not have been anymore friendlier, courteous or effecient.hotel lived up to its 4 star rating.anything you requested was carried out in a very effecient manner.having stayed at this hotel i cannot understand the negative reviews that this hotel has received.Thanks to the staff for making my stay in rome very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain - okay”
Reviews.Author: FEUNL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It takes literally 10 mins on foot to reach the Coliseum and then a further 10 mins on foot and you are in central Rome, so really great location. When we went the metro station Manzoni (which is literally outside the Hotel's door) was being refurbished, which meant we had to walk 10 mins to another metro San Giovanni. A little annoying after a long day's walking around. The Hotel is fine. It isn't anything special, so I wouldn't recommend for people who give great importance to the Hotel they stay at (as a major contribution to their overall holiday satisfaction). The rooms are big for a city hotel. The beds are big and comfy. The decor is modern and clean. There is ample storage space and the bathroom was clean. However, we had a shower (we wanted a bath), we did get a top floor room (there are 7 floors in total). The bathroom seems much older than the bedroom and never looked very clean (think sparkling!). The towels were chic i.e. napkin material, so we only had 2 large bath towels. The napkins don't work for drying long hair! The hairdryer had one setting - melt scalp temperature! The room's heating system was AWFUL. It had no humidity to it, so we awoke with dry throats, noses and eyes. When we opened the window to get "real air" we just got colder. Naturally, we both got a cold. But no stress. The TV has just 2 English channels that are not pay-per-view: CNN and Sky News. The rest are dubbed in Italian (naturally). The breakfast is until 10:30 and very good: eggs, bacon, yoghurts, croissants, cereals, coffee, juice etc. It wasn't delicious, but was just fine for the standard of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. They spoke many languages and we had no problems at all. I wouldn't stay there again though, unless I had no other option. I chose the hotel as it offered a good rate, but next time I will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: run2caz
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and tidy hotel. Good sized rooms with the little extras. Breakfast good, well spread out time. Barman very nice and chatty, drink in bar very well priced. All the other staff helpful. Our room was at the front of the hotel on main road, so lot of traffic noise - day and night (tip ask for room at rear of hotel). Otherwise hotel was ideal for our needs, on edge of sights but all within walking distance. Very nice pizza restaurant couple of doors away (went on our last night there and was best meal we had whole time)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Price”
Reviews.Author: Sandra26
Reviews.Content: The four-star hotel is reasonably priced, rooms are all refurbished with excellently working air conditioning. Staff was friendly, our room was clean. The hotel is centrally located, the closest tube is around a five minute walk away. All in all I would easily recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it's not all that bad...”
Reviews.Author: indilicious
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Italy, we stayed at this hotel twice. Upon our first arrival, we were told by an indifferent - not rude, just indifferent - receptionist that we had to wait an hour for our room. The room was ready in about half an hour and we were ushered there by a very corteous member of staff. The room was on the 6th floor and was rather dingy - it had obviously been met with a substantial amount of wear-and-tear. Even though we were on one of the top-most floors, the room was quite noisy at night. Cars zoomed by until the early hours of the morning and a hospital nearby meant ambulance sirens could be heard at all hours of the day. The breakfast was below par and the breakfast room had a peculairly nauseating stench in it. This defintely needs imporvement. Our worst experience with this hotel occured just after we had been pickpocketed in a Rome subway train. We had rushed back to the hotel in a state of frenzied panic and had asked the receptionist to ring up Visa and American Express so that we could cancel our credit cards. Instead of being sympathetic, the receptionist was intolerant. When we found the phoneline was busy, we rushed to the counter again to ask if there was some mistake. He practically screamed at us, telling us to wait and be patient. It was the first time our credit cards had ever been stolen and we were extremely worried...the last thing we needed was a rude response from the receptionist. Overall, the hotel was pretty average and we would stay here again if there was no other option. After all, there is nothing MAJORLY wrong with this hotel...there's just nothing particularly positive about it (except the fact that it is a 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum).

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: d.currie
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the number of negative comments on the recent postings. I stayed in this hotel 2 years ago ,and have just returned from another enjoyable long week end there. I would not hesitate to stay there again. I have had very modern/clean rooms on both occasions as have the other 4 members of my party. The staff are helpful and friendly. the hotel bar prices are very keen for a city hotel. if I had to make a criticism I would say the breakfast is not the best I have had in a 4 star hotel ,but it is perfectly adequate. manzoni tube station is currently shut but other tube stop victor emmanuel not far. There is agreat restaurant round the corner the Cannavota. we had the hotel arrange a mini bus for 6 from the airport it was great- a hassle free start to our city break. at 90euros it was not cheap but between 6 not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mobius1
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly acceptable relatively modern hotel in a good central location. Rooms were not exactly huge (same as rest of Rome) but were clean and functional and the bathroom was a decent sized separate room. Cable TV had CNN and Sky news. The best thing about the hotel is that you can get continental breakfast delivered to your room. Tipped the waiter a couple of Euros each time as I think it is expected. Staff were in my experience OK. Bummer about the experiences of the previous poster though. The Manzoni area in general felt safe. Decent pizza places next to hotel and fancier restaurants within 5 minute walk. Food in Rome is superb! MAJOR POINT: the Manzoni metro stop outside the hotel is closed for refurbishment! However it is only a 5 mins walk to next one up or down. Buses and trams go past the hotel anyway but you can walk to the Coliseum/Forum etc. within 10 minutes. Ended up walking to North areas (Spanish steps, Trevi etc.) as well. Most sites in Rome are within walking distance if you are keen! Metro was handy for the Vatican museums though. We did however have a bad 'stereotype' experience within half hour of arriving: my girlfriend had purse with some Euros stolen from her handbag on a packed tube as we tried to get to hotel from Termini. Despite being cautious we were hit by the 'professionals'. My advice is to stay off the metro until you get rid of your luggage and can be more vigilant against these guys. They look out for the newbies struggling with the bags! Taxi to hotel from Termini should cost no more than 8-10 Euros. We were determined not to let it spoil our holiday and the subsequent 4 days reaffirmed our enjoyment of this splendid city. I would stay here again here for sure. Would love to go to Roma vs. Lazio derby game next time!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Best Western !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During our stay at the President my wife and I used the restaraunt rather than dining out on a half board basis.. HUGE MISTAKE. The food at this hotel is very 3rd rate (my wife is a qualified chef which shocked them so they could not argue any point). The room was in poor repair and in need of some TLC but we survived. In fairness the staff are quite friendly but gutless where complaints are concerned saying that certain aspects were "policy". If you want a good hotel in Rome then forget any connected with Best Western if "policy" is that companies idea of customer service. I have emailed them but they dont want to reply to me ...AHHH BLESS.

Reviews.Title: “President hotel - Rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: RachaelD
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website I was a little aprehensive as to what to expect from this hotel. Our stay at the President was for 3 nights it was pleasant enough, however after a break previously in Florence at a 4* hotel, the President left a lot to be desired. The general location of the hotel was fine, although I would not suggest walking through the Termini area to the hotel especially if you are female. Take the metro for 1 euro you can travel anywhere in the city. Get off at Manzoni and you are right outside the hotel. Its a 5 min walk to the Colleseum, 10 min walk to Vittori Emmanuelle & Via de Corso. If you are planning to go to the spanish step or Vatican city take the metro. Its a 20min ride to the Vatican compared to the hour it took us to walk. Back to the hotel, the staff were friendly enough and the hotel seemed to be clean. The furniture and furnishings however seemed worn and in need to revamping, its certainly rough around the edges but ok for a 1 night break, I would certainly next time spend more for a higher quality. The rooms at night were stuffy the heating was on and it could not be adjusted, this led to us sleeping with the windows open. Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking the courtyard, wit the window open in the morning its was quite noisy. I would hate to think how noisy it would be on a lower floor overlooking the main road. The rooms were large enough although the bathrooms were long and narrow and you couldnt open the door fully due to the sink unit. Overall you get what you pay for! Rachel UK

Reviews.Title: “it was a relieve”
Reviews.Author: jwillemb
Reviews.Content: we were worried by the revieuw's we did reed on the side but we where very relieved that we found everything in very good order. Our room, nr 126, was spacious, clean, perfect big bed, nice decorated, perfect bathroom and so on. Every day clean big towells, soaps and other care products and cleaning. Breakfast was various with eggs, bacon, sorts of bread, sweets and so on again. Staff was very friendly. Situation next to metro with perfect rest. CANNAVOTA near by. Surrounding is safe. There were no negatif remarks to make. We booked a 5 night stay for only 630 euro and that was cheap for what we did get compare to rome hotel prices. NEXT TIME AGAIN 100% PRESIDENT.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Ever....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights as part of my honeymoon and it was such a let down. The travel agent informed us this was a four star hotel but I can honestly say I have experienced better student accomodation and cooking. The rooms are tiny and like other reviewers, we had two single beds pushed together with one pillow each. The pillows were hard and uncomfortable. The brochure informed us that tea/coffee facilities were available by asking reception - I would have thought that a four star establishment would have provided such facilities in the room. The staff at the reception were ignorant - on at least two occassions, I was left waiting there after I had made inital contact whilst they attended to paperwork. The room was so noisy - you could hear the water and other sounds from the bathrooms in the other rooms surrounding us. As for the breakfast, you have virtually no choice - most days I made do with watery juice and dry croissants. There was no fresh fruit/yoghurt on offer ever so if you are anyway health conscious, avoid this horrendous experience. The area surrounding the hotel did not seem great although the metro is next door. Probably the second worst place I have ever stayed....

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean & cool”
Reviews.Author: McJax
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a weekend break package and thought it was fine for the price. The room was spotless and cool, excellent shower, buffet breakfast was okay - lots of bread, pastries, cakes ... nothing gourmet but that suited us as we were happy with Rome's lunch & dinner options (although, my husband is a vegetarian and was disappointed overall with the lack of veggie options other than pasta & pizza which luckily he loves !). The hotel bar was very nice and surprisingly cheap - after a hard day sightseeing in the blazing sun (who's idea was it to visit Rome in August ???), coming back to the hotel's cool air-con'd lounge for a drink was great. Would recommend the hotel if you don't mind being slightly out of the main city but the walk into the city takes you via the Coloseum and the Forum which is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good quality and well located”
Reviews.Author: brindlg
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideal for the price. It's close to all the sights in Rome (A walk from the colosseum), has a metro station right outside (goes to the Vatican in about 20 mins), and is good quality for the price. We had a room on the top floor and had breakfast brought to the room each of the two days which was free. The Hotel is close to Termini railway station (you can walk in about 15 mins, get a taxi or go on the metro). This station has a direct link to the airport so it's nice and easy. The room was fine. I would say a good 3* in the UK. I was worried after seeing a lot of hotels either of poor quality or miles out of town. A taxi home from the old town is about ?7, though we walked there on the first day to catch the sights (about 30 mins). Was very happy with the choice, and it was well priced too.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is excellent for the metro, with the Manzoni station right outside. Staff were friendly and helpful, particularly an older gentleman on reception who provided location map, excursion brochures etc before we even had thought to ask! The hotel itself was clean and tidy and the bedroom was well kept. The bedroom had a small fridge which was very useful for storing drinks and fruit as the rooms did not have tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was a good size with plenty of fresh towels. The bar staff were also friendly and polite, the drinks reasonably priced and the bar area clean and tidy. Some sound insulation in the hotel rooms would be beneficial as we could hear every word spoken in the rooms adjoining ours (we did not have any adjoining doors, all the noise was coming through the walls) which was quite annoying. We were woken frequently during the night and early mornings by a crying child. Not exactly the wake up call we were hoping for having gone away for a relaxing weekend. Breakfast was disappointing, very limited choices. There were pastries and bread rolls which were hard and stale, cold ham, egg and hot dog sausages kept warm but not hot, limited cereals and bowls of tinned fruit. There were no cooked options available and I would have expected at least toast to be offered. We stayed for 4 days and the food was the same each day. Being a Best Western (UK) employee for a number of years I was surprised that the breakfast standards here were so poor as Best Western do have above average standards when rating hotels. The President claims to be a 4 star hotel, but in my opinion would struggle to gain 3 stars in the UK. The hotel itself is very well located, the reception, bar, restaurant and rooms clean and tidy, the staff are great but the noisy rooms and poor food lets it down.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: casalinda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of our vacation in Italy. We booked two-connecting non-smoking rooms. The rooms they gave us were the most pitiful looking thread-bare noisy rooms in the hotel. Our room smelled like an ash-tray but they said they could not move us because they were full. So I asked for the bedsrpeads to be replaced because they were filthy and smelled horrible. The front desk said "no" because they were fully booked. I then asked for an extra top bedsheet, but was told "no" because they were fully booked. So we went to bed to try to sleep but the A/C went off around 1:30 in the morning and it got very hot in our room. When we contacted the front desk, we were told that the A/C is always shut off for 6 hours at night. After that night we were ready to move to another hotel. However, the manager came and apologized for all the problems and wanted us to move to another room. So we moved. The room they gave us was large, clean and actually rather pretty. This makes me wonder why we were put in that awful room in the first place. The front desk was helpful even though they had limited English ability. I know that I would never stay at this hotel again. The location was terrible and I would not feel safe walking around in that area at night. They did provide a free basic breakfast, the staff was friendly and helpful, but it is only one of those places to stay if you have no other options.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel for average tourist”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable 4 star hotel for the average tourist. We stayed here for 4 nights in January 2005. The room was modern and clean. Good size bathroom with nice shower accessories. Location is convenient, outside the front door are steps to the subway station. It is also a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. The breakfast was a cold buffet, including fresh breadrolls and a nice selection of teas. For the price we paid, we were very satisfied. Highly recommend this hotel to tourists on a budget looking for something conveniently located, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DCMC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for six nights in March 2005 as part of our honeymoon in Italy. We were initially given a room that smelt like an ashtray and were changed to a non smoking room when requested. The beds and pillows were very uncomfortable and our double room had 2 single beds pushed together with single bed clothes on them. The walls were paper thin. We heard people snoring, having baths/showers and full conversations as if the people were in the room with us. The room service each day was minimal. Some of the breakfast staff were very rude too. We will probably not stay in another Best Western Hotel after our stay in this one. However it is right next to a metro station and the bar staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, good base for Rome Mararathon!”
Reviews.Author: Spanishtraveller
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its proximity ( a 10 min walk ) to the start of the Marathon (in March )at the Colosseum . Hotel is average , staff were friendly and fairly helpful , breakfast was poor , besides Manzini Metro station for easy access to the rest of the City . Value for money if you get a discounted rate .

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad --- but hot dogs for breakfast??”
Reviews.Author: sox1fan
Reviews.Content: The room was anti-septic and completely lacking in character, but it was spacious and clean (it contained a small fridge with a few items and room for us to stock our own drinks/food). I found the service to be somewhat lacking (ok, ok, it was pretty poor) and a far cry from other hotels where we stayed across Italy (my wife and i were on our honeymoon and this was the only hotel that did NOTHING to make us feel special... unlike Locando Orseolo in Venice which was AMAZING and Residenza Il Villino in Florence which was VERY good)... on a scale of 1-10, the service was a 3... the breakfast in the morning consisted of watery eggs, mini hot dogs and hard rolls... on the plus side, and it is a BIG plus, it is marvelously situated (steps from the subway and 8 - 10 blocks from The Coloseum)... and, ten doors down on the same side of the street, my wife and I found THE BEST pizza we have ever had (Pizzeria Il Veliero Sicilia)... the owner was fantastic and constantly shoved free samples at us... and as native Bostonians who have often trolled the North End we have both had some excellent pizza, but this was fantastic...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from 2/22-27/05 as part of a group tour. We had a room on the 5th floor. It was the largest room I have ever had in my many years of traveling in Europe. We had a king size, bed, a pull out couch, t.v. with remote, a small refrigerator, a key pad safe, large bathroom with a hairdryer that worked. The room was very clean. The hotel caters to groups so it was noisy sometimes. There is a metro stop right in front of the hotel, and it was a 10 minute walk to the Collesium- and two stops from the main train station. I did not feel unsafe in this area. Don't eat any meals except breakfast in the hotel- food was terrible and service was so so. Breakfast was cereal, meat, cheese, pastries, eggs, and canned sausages. Coffee was from a machine. Juice was ok. You can get plenty of coldwater. The staff was very helpful-others in our group didn't think so-- but I thought they were great especially with the number of groups staying at the hotel at the time-they even made reservations for me to tour the Vatican. I think we lucked out with the bigger room-- definitely would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel President
HotelInfo.Address: Via Emanuele Filiberto 173, 00185 Rome, Italy
